method.name: Transformation
method.description: equivalent to "new flash.geom.Matrix(ax,bx,ay,by,cy,cx)"

method.name: toString
method.description: String signature of the current transformation.

method.name: transform
method.description: Transform a point.

method.name: untransform
method.description: Inverse of transform; p = untransform(transform(p))

method.name: normalize
method.description: This function normalizes latitude and longitude values to a sensible range (±84°N, ±180°E), and returns a new Location instance.

method.name: coordinateLocation
method.return: untransformed and unprojected location for a coordinate.

method.name: locationCoordinate
method.return: projected and transformed coordinate for a location.

method.name: toString
method.description: String signature of the current projection.

method.name: approxDistance
method.description:
you can specify different units by optionally providing the earth's radius in the units you desire

Default is 6,378,000 metres, suggested values are:

  • 3963.1 statute miles
  • 3443.9 nautical miles
  • 6378 km
method.return: distance between given start and end locations in metres

classRec.name: Overlay
classRec.description: Overlay simplifies adding vector graphics to your map. Subclass Overlay and override the redraw(sprite:Sprite) method to use it.

method.name: redraw
method.description: redraw the overlay onto the given Sprite - override this in your subclass

classRec.name: NavigatorWindow
classRec.description:
NavigatorWindow creates a small navigator map that will stick to the bottom right-hand edge of a map and provide a zoomed-out context for the current visible area.
The main 'magic' performed by this class is suppressing the map events from the nav map so that they don't bubble up and confused overlays that are listening to the map. This would be an issue because the navigator window might be added as a child of map. I considered making it an option in Map and TileGrid to disable events, but then I realised I wanted the navMap to be interactive after all so that it could update the main map.
Hat tip to http://www.cartogrammar.com/blog/map-panning-and-zooming-methods/ for prompting the development of this class.
Exercises for the reader: 1) add alignment options (top left etc.)? 2) add show and hide buttons 3) add dragging for resizing 4) add optional alternate map providers (a la maps.live.com)?

method.name: NavigatorWindow
method.description: create a new navigator window with optional size and style parameters

Event.name: copyrightChanged
Event.description:
VERY EXPERIMENTAL, requires javascript, uses this technique: http://www.actionscript.org/resources/articles/745/1/JavaScript-and-VBScript-Injection-in-ActionScript-3/Page1.html
TODO: update spans for Microsoft, add Yahoo :)
In general, lots of this needs reworking... at least, IMapProviders should be able to provide copyright strings without requiring javascript, and without needing to edit this file.

method.name: callCopyright
method.description: Call javascript:modestMaps.copyright() with details about current view. See js/copyright.js.

method.name: setCopyright
method.description:
this function gets exposed to javascript as a callback
to display the copyright string in your flash piece, you then need to listen for the COPYRIGHT_CHANGED MapEvent, or add MapCopyright as a child of map for a basic implementation.

field.name: copyright
field.description: htmlText to be added to a label - listen for MapEvent.COPYRIGHT_CHANGED

classRec.name: ZoomSlider
classRec.description:
This is an example of a slider that modifies the zoom level of the given map.
It is provided mainly for ModestMapsSample.as and to test the arbitrary zoom level functionality, but feel free to use it if you like yellow bevels.

classRec.name: MapControls
classRec.description:
this is a bit of a silly class really, implementing a whole mini layout framework just so that you don't have to have the same button layout that I like.
even though you have to have rounded corners and bevels.
take that!

classRec.name: GreatCircleOverlay
classRec.description: a subclass of overlay that will render dashed great-circle arcs

method.name: encloseExtent
method.description: enlarges this extent so that the given extent is inside it

method.name: enclose
method.description: enlarges this extent so that the given location is inside it

method.name: fromLocations
method.description: calculate the north/south/east/west extremes of the given array of locations

method.name: fromString
method.description: Creates a new MapExtent from the given String.
method.return: a new MapExtent from the given string

method.name: container
method.description: Return a new coordinate that corresponds to that of the tile containing this one

method.name: equalTo
method.description: Returns true if the the two coordinates refer to the same Tile location.

method.name: destroy
method.description: once TileGrid is done with a tile, it will call destroy and possibly reuse it later

method.name: init
method.description: override this in a subclass and call grid.setTileClass if you want to draw on your tiles

method.name: enforceBoundsOnMatrix
method.description: this may seem like a heavy function, but it only gets called once per render and it doesn't have any loops, so it flies by, really

method.name: enforceBounds
method.description: called inside of onRender before events are fired enforceBoundsOnMatrix modifies worldMatrix directly doesn't use scale/zoomLevel setters to correct values otherwise we'd get stuck in a loop!

method.name: getCoordTile
method.description: Get the Tile instance that corresponds to a given coordinate.

method.name: getVisibleTiles
method.description: returns an array of all the tiles that are on the screen (including parent and child tiles currently visible until the current zoom level finishes loading)

method.name: onEnterFrame
method.description: processes the tileQueue and optionally outputs stats into debugField

method.name: onRender
method.description:
figures out from worldMatrix which tiles we should be showing, adds them to the stage, adds them to the tileQueue if needed, etc.
from my recent testing, TileGrid.onRender takes < 5ms most of the time, and rarely >10ms (Flash Player 9, Firefox, Macbook Pro)

method.name: repopulateVisibleTiles
method.description: loops over given cols and rows and adds tiles to visibleTiles array and the well using child or parent tiles to compensate for tiles not yet available in the tileCache

method.name: requestLoad
method.description: create a tile and add it to the queue - WARNING: this is buggy for the current zoom level, it's only used for parent zooms when maxParentLoad is > 0

method.name: setTileClass
method.description: The classes themselves serve as factories!

method.name: tileKey
method.description: zoom is translated into a letter so that keys can easily be sorted (alphanumerically) by zoom level

method.name: currentTileZoom
method.description: read-only, this is the level of tiles we'll be loading first

method.name: maxZoom
method.description: derived from map provider by calculateBounds(), read-only here for convenience

method.name: minZoom
method.description: derived from map provider by calculateBounds(), read-only here for convenience

method.name: tileHeight
method.description: convenience method for tileHeight

method.name: tileWidth
method.description: convenience method for tileWidth

field.name: enforceBoundsEnabled
field.description: set this to true to enable enforcing of map bounds from the map provider's limits

field.name: maxChildSearch
field.description: if we don't have a tile at currentZoom, onRender will look for tiles up to one levels further in. set this to 0 if you only want the current zoom level's tiles WARNING: bad, bad nasty recursion possibilities really soon if you go much above 1 - it works, but you probably don't want to change this number :)

field.name: maxParentLoad
field.description: if maxParentSearch is enabled, setting maxParentLoad to between 1 and maxParentSearch will make requests for lower zoom levels first

field.name: maxParentSearch
field.description: if we don't have a tile at currentZoom, onRender will look for tiles up to 5 levels out. set this to 0 if you only want the current zoom level's tiles WARNING: tiles will get scaled up A LOT for this, but maybe it beats blank tiles?

field.name: maxTilesToKeep
field.description: this is the maximum size of tileCache (visible tiles will also be kept in the cache)

field.name: roundPositionsEnabled
field.description: set this to false, along with roundScalesEnabled, if you need a map to stay 'fixed' in place as it changes size

field.name: roundScalesEnabled
field.description: set this to false, along with roundPositionsEnabled, if you need a map to stay 'fixed' in place as it changes size

interfaceRec.name: Redrawable
interfaceRec.description: used by PolygonClip to trigger a redraw when zoom levels have changed substantially

classRec.name: Polyline

method.name: onMarkerClick
method.description:
Dispatches MarkerEvent.CLICK when a marker is clicked.
The MarkerEvent includes a reference to the marker and its location.

method.name: onMarkerRollOut
method.description:
Dispatches MarkerEvent.ROLL_OUT
The MarkerEvent includes a reference to the marker and its location.

method.name: onMarkerRollOver
method.description:
Dispatches MarkerEvent.ROLL_OVER
The MarkerEvent includes a reference to the marker and its location.

method.name: resetCoordinates
method.description: call this if you've made a change to the underlying map geometry such that provider.locationCoordinate(location) will return a different coordinate

method.name: sortMarkersByYPosition
method.description: This is the function provided to markers.sort() in order to determine which markers should go in front of the others. The default behavior is to place markers further down on the screen (with higher y values) frontmost. You can modify this behavior by specifying a different value for MarkerClip.markerSortFunction

method.name: updateClip
method.description: returns true if the marker was added to the stage, so that updateClips or attachMarker can sort the markers

field.name: autoCache
field.description: if autoCache is true, we turn on cacheAsBitmap while panning, but off while zooming

field.name: scaleZoom
field.description: enable this if you want intermediate zooming steps to stretch your graphics instead of reprojecting the points it's useful for polygons, but for points it looks worse and probably isn't faster, but there it is :)

field.name: zoomTolerance
field.description: if scaleZoom is true, this is how many zoom levels you can zoom by before things will be reprojected regardless

classRec.name: PolylineClip

method.name: clipLineToRect
method.description: Clips a line (passed as 2 points) to a rectangle. Returns true if the line is at all visible, false if not

method.name: lineIntersectLine
method.description: Test for a line intersection. TODO - tidy up as no need to calc line equation twice

method.name: updatePolyline
method.description: Update an individual polyline - determine its visibility and draw if so

method.name: updatePolylines
method.description: Redraw each active polyline

method.name: PolygonMarker
method.description:
Creates a polygon from the given array (or array of arrays) of Locations.
The polygon will use the given map to project the locations, and should be added to an instance of PolygonClip, which will add and remove it from the stage and position it as required.
If an array of arrays of Locations is given, the first array will be drawn as the outer ring of the polygon, and subsequent arrays will be treated as holes if they overlap it.

classRec.name: PolygonClip
classRec.description:
PolygonClip extends MarkerClip to take the bounds of the marker into account when showing/hiding, and to trigger a redraw of content that needs scaling.
To trigger the redraw, markers must implement the Redrawable interface provided in this package.
See PolygonMarker for an example, but if you need multi-geometries, complex styling, holes etc., you'll need to write your own for the moment.

method.name: coordinateLocation
method.return: untransformed and unprojected location for a coordinate.

method.name: geometry
method.description: A string which describes the projection and transformation of a map provider.

method.name: getTileUrls
method.return: an array of Strings urls (or URLRequests) for the images needed for this tile coordinate.

method.name: locationCoordinate
method.return: projected and transformed coordinate for a location.

method.name: outerLimits
method.description: Get top left outer-zoom limit and bottom right inner-zoom limits, as Coordinates in a two element array.

method.name: sourceCoordinate
method.description: Munge coordinate for purposes of image selection and marker containment. E.g., useful for cylindical projections with infinite horizontal scroll.

packageRec.name: org.apache.flex.maps.mapproviders.null
packageRec.author: darren
migurski
Igor Costa $Id$ AbstractMapProvider is the base class for all MapProviders.

method.name: outerLimits
method.description: Get top left outer-zoom limit and bottom right inner-zoom limits, as Coordinates in a two element array.

method.name: sourceCoordinate
method.description:
Wraps the column around the earth, doesn't touch the row.
Row coordinates shouldn't be outside of outerLimits, so we shouldn't need to worry about them here.

packageRec.name: org.apache.flex.maps.mapproviders.null
packageRec.description: MapProvider for Open Street Map data.
packageRec.author: migurski $Id$

method.name: defineImageProperties
method.description: Zoomifyer EZ (download: http://www.zoomify.com/express.htm) cuts a base image into tiles, and creates a metadata file named ImageProperties.xml in the same directory. Instead of parsing that file, pass the relevant bits to this method. Base directory usthave a trailing slash. Example: ImageProperties.xml content: <IMAGE_PROPERTIES WIDTH="11258" HEIGHT="7085" NUMTILES="1650" NUMIMAGES="1" VERSION="1.8" TILESIZE="256" /> URL of ImageProperties.xml: http://example.com/ImageProperties.xml Corresponding call to defineImageProperties(): defineImageProperties('http://example.com/', 11258, 7085); Tiles created by Zoomifyer EZ are placed in folders named "TileGroup{0..n}", in groups of 256, so we need to quickly iterate through the entire set of tile coordinates to determine where the group boundaries are. These are stored in the __groups array.

packageRec.name: org.apache.flex.maps.mapproviders.null
packageRec.description: MapProvider for a WMS server, in either EPSG:4326 or EPSG:900913

method.name: DailyPlanetProvider
method.description: WARNING: this is extremely experimental, and it might not make the correct calls to NASA every time we are still testing 512px providers, too

field.name: key
field.description: see http://developers.cloudmade.com/projects to get hold of an API key

field.name: style
field.description: use the constants above or see maps.cloudmade.com for more styles

method.name: deriveTransformation
method.description: Generates a transform based on three pairs of points, l1 -> p1, l2 -> p2, l3 -> p3.

method.name: linearSolution
method.description:
Solves a system of linear equations.
t1 = (a r1) + (b + s1) + c t2 = (a r2) + (b + s2) + c t3 = (a r3) + (b + s3) + c
r1 - t3 are the known values. a, b, c are the unknowns to be solved. returns the a, b, c coefficients.

method.name: convertToBinary
method.return:
32 digit binary representation of numberToConvert
NB:- don't use int.toString(2) here because it doesn't do what we want with negative numbers - which is wrap around and pad with 1's. Hence convert to uint first.

field.name: RENDERED
field.description: listen out for this if you want to be sure map is in its final state before reprojecting markers etc.

classRec.name: TileCache
classRec.description: the alreadySeen Dictionary here will contain up to grid.maxTilesToKeep Tiles

classRec.name: TilePool
classRec.description:
This post http://lab.polygonal.de/2008/06/18/using-object-pools/ suggests that using Object pools, especially for complex classes like Sprite is a lot faster than calling new Object(). The suggested implementation uses a linked list, but to get started with it here I'm using an Array.
If anyone wants to try it with a linked list and compare the times, it seems like it could be worth it :)

method.name: processQueue
method.description: called by the onEnterFrame handler to manage the tileQueue usual operation is extremely quick, ~1ms or so

method.name: setTileClass
method.description: The classes themselves serve as factories!

field.name: cacheLoaders
field.description: with tile providers that you have crossdomain.xml support for, it's possible to avoid extra requests by reusing bitmapdata. enable cacheLoaders to try and do that

field.name: maxOpenRequests
field.description: how many Loaders are allowed to be open at once?

field.name: smoothContent
field.description: set this to true to enable bitmap smoothing on tiles - requires crossdomain.xml permissions so won't work online with most providers

packageRec.name: org.apache.flex.maps.null
packageRec.author: migurski
darren
tom com.modestmaps.Map is the base class and interface for Modest Maps.
packageRec.usage: import com.modestmaps.Map; import com.modestmaps.geo.Location; import com.modestmaps.mapproviders.BlueMarbleMapProvider; ... var map:Map = new Map(640, 480, true, new BlueMarbleMapProvider()); addChild(map);

method.name: GeoMap
method.description: Initialize the map: set properties, add a tile grid, draw it. Default extent covers the entire globe, (+/-85, +/-180).
method.param: Whether the map can be dragged or not.
Desired map provider, e.g. Blue Marble.
Either a MapExtent or a Location and zoom (comma separated)

method.name: getHeight
method.description: Get map height.

method.name: getMapProvider
method.description: Get a reference to the current map provider.

method.name: getMarker
method.description: Get a marker with the given id if one was created.

method.name: getSize
method.description: Get map size.

method.name: getWidth
method.description: Get map width.

method.name: locationPoint
method.description: Get a point (x, y) for a location (lat, lon) in the context of a given clip.
method.param: Movie clip context in which returned point should make sense.

method.name: onDoubleClick
method.description: pans and zooms in on double clicked location

method.name: onExtentChanged
method.description:
Dispatches MapEvent.EXTENT_CHANGED when the map is recentered. The MapEvent includes the new extent.
TODO: dispatch this on resize? TODO: should we move Map to com.modestmaps.core so that this could be made internal instead of public?

method.name: onExtentChanging
method.description: Dispatches MapEvent.BEGIN_EXTENT_CHANGE when the map is about to be resized. The MapEvent includes the current.

method.name: panAndZoomBy
method.description: zoom in or out by sc, moving the given location to the requested target

method.name: panAndZoomIn
method.description: zoom in and put the given location in the center of the screen, or optionally at the given targetPoint

method.name: panAndZoomOut
method.description: zoom out and put the given location in the center of the screen, or optionally at the given targetPoint

method.name: panDown
method.description: Pan down by 1/3 (or panFraction) of the map height.

method.name: panLeft
method.description: Pan left by 1/3 (or panFraction) of the map width.

method.name: panRight
method.description: Pan left by 1/3 (or panFraction) of the map width.

method.name: panUp
method.description: Pan up by 1/3 (or panFraction) of the map height.

method.name: pointLocation
method.description: Get a location (lat, lon) for a point (x, y) in the context of a given clip.
method.param: Movie clip context in which passed point should make sense.

method.name: putMarker
method.description: Add a marker at the given location (lat, lon)
method.param: optionally, a sprite (where sprite.name=id) that will always be in the right place

method.name: removeMarker
method.description: Remove a marker with the given id.

method.name: rotateByAbout
method.description: rotate by angle (radians), keeping the requested point in the same place

method.name: setCenterZoom
method.description: Based on a location and zoom level, determine appropriate initial tile coordinate and point using calculateMapCenter(), and inform the grid of tile coordinate and point by calling grid.resetTiles().

method.name: setCenter
method.description: put the given location in the middle of the map

method.name: setExtent
method.description: Based on an array of locations, determine appropriate map bounds using calculateMapExtent(), and inform the grid of tile coordinate and point by calling grid.resetTiles(). Resulting map extent will ensure that all passed locations are visible.
method.param: extent the minimum area to fit inside the map view

method.name: setMapProvider
method.description: Set a new map provider, repainting tiles and changing bounding box if necessary.

method.name: setRotation
method.description: rotate to angle (radians), keeping the requested point in the same place

method.name: setSize
method.description: Set new map size, dispatch MapEvent.RESIZED. The MapEvent includes the newSize.

method.name: setZoom
method.description: Based on a zoom level, determine appropriate initial tile coordinate and point using calculateMapCenter(), and inform the grid of tile coordinate and point by calling grid.resetTiles().

method.name: zoomByAbout
method.description: zoom in or out by zoomDelta, keeping the requested point in the same place

method.name: zoomBy
method.description:
Adds dir to grid.zoomLevel, and rounds up or down to the nearest whole number. Used internally by zoomIn and zoomOut (keeping it DRY, as they say) and overridden by TweenMap for animation.

grid.zoomLevel calls the grid.scale setter for us which will call grid.prepareForZooming if we didn't already and grid.doneZooming after modifying the zoom level.

Animating/tweening grid.scale fires START_ZOOMING, and STOP_ZOOMING MapEvents unless you call grid.prepareForZooming first. Be sure to also call grid.stopZooming at the end of your animation.
method.param: dir the direction of zoom, generally 1 for zooming in, or -1 for zooming out

method.name: zoomInAbout
method.description: zoom in, keeping the requested point in the same place

method.name: zoomIn
method.description:
Zoom in by one zoom level (to 200%) immediately, rounding up to the nearest zoom level if we're currently between zooms.

Triggers MapEvent.START_ZOOMING and MapEvent.STOP_ZOOMING events.
method.param: event an optional event so that zoomIn can directly function as an event listener.

method.name: zoomOutAbout
method.description: zoom out, keeping the requested point in the same place

method.name: zoomOut
method.description:
Zoom out by one zoom level (to 50%) immediately, rounding down to the nearest zoom level if we're currently between zooms.

Triggers MapEvent.START_ZOOMING and MapEvent.STOP_ZOOMING events.
method.param: event an optional event so that zoomOut can directly function as an event listener.

field.name: grid
field.description: das grid

field.name: mapProvider
field.description: Who do we get our Map urls from? How far can we pan?

field.name: markerClip
field.description: markers are attached here

field.name: panFraction
field.description: fraction of width/height to pan panLeft, panRight, panUp, panDown

packageRec.name: org.apache.flex.maps.null
packageRec.author: tom com.modestmaps.TweenMap adds smooth animated panning and zooming to the basic Map class

method.name: onMouseWheel
method.description: Zooms in or out of mouse-wheeled location, rounded off to nearest whole zoom level when zooming ends.

method.name: panAndZoomBy
method.description: zoom in or out by sc, moving the given location to the requested target (or map center, if omitted)

method.name: panAndZoomComplete
method.description: call grid.donePanning() and grid.doneZooming(), used by tweenExtent, panAndZoomBy and zoomByAbout as a TweenLite onComplete function

method.name: panBy
method.description: Pan by px and py, in panDuration (used by panLeft, panRight, panUp and panDown)

method.name: panTo
method.description:
Put the given location in the middle of the map, animated in panDuration using panEase.
Use setCenter or setCenterZoom for big jumps, set forceAnimate to true if you really want to animate to a location that's currently off screen. But no promises!

method.name: quadraticEaseOut
method.description: default easing function for panUp, panDown, panLeft, panRight, etc.

method.name: tweenExtent
method.description: EXPERIMENTAL!

method.name: tweenTo
method.description: Animate to put the given location in the middle of the map. Use setCenter or setCenterZoom for big jumps, or panTo for pre-defined animation.

method.name: zoomByAbout
method.description: zoom in or out by zoomDelta, keeping the requested point in the same place

field.name: panAndZoomDuration
field.description: time to pan and zoom using, uh, panAndZoom

field.name: panDuration
field.description: time to pan using panLeft, panRight, panUp, panDown

field.name: panEase
field.description: easing function used for panLeft, panRight, panUp, panDown

field.name: zoomDuration
field.description: time to zoom using zoomIn, zoomOut

field.name: zoomEase
field.description: easing function used for zoomIn, zoomOut

packageRec.name: org.apache.flex.maps.flex.null
packageRec.description:
$Id$ Copyright 2013 Allens and Igor Costa Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at
http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. GeoMap class is an ActionScript UI component. To use it in your application, simply specify a new namespace in the root node of your application. As long as the com.modestmaps.flex namespace is in your path, Flex Builder should find the class and auto-complete the element name once you've opened a new tag and typed the namespace.
The MXML component doesn't currently support the full org.apache.flex.Map API, but the instance of that class is accessible via the (read-only) "map" getter if you need to call any of its methods.

method.name: commitProperties
method.description: Updates the map's provider, extent or center/zoom, and size. This is called by the Flex framework when necessary. There's probably some more optimization that could be done in the whole invalidation/validation/update process; for instance, a flag set in invalidateSize() could be used to determine whether or not we should call _map.setSize(), rather than just comparing the size.

method.name: map
method.description: Since we're not yet supporting the full Map interface, make the instance gettable, read-only.

method.name: center
method.description: Like the "extent" setter, the "center" setter accepts a String in addition to a Location object, so that locations can be specified in MXML attributes as strings ("lat, lon").

method.name: draggable
method.description: Currently the "draggable" setter will only work pre-initialization. In other words, setting draggable after the component has been initialized will have no effect; it's provided merely as a means for setting the property in MXML.

method.name: extent
method.description: The "extent" setter accepts either a MapExtent instance or a String; the latter is converted into a MapExtent using the static fromString() method. This allows the extent to be defined as a string in MXML attributes, a la "north, south, east, west".

method.name: provider
method.description:
The "provider" setter accepts either a String (Flex Builder should provide a list of valid values per the Inspectable() metadata tag) or an IMapProvider instance. You can specify the latter in MXML by wrapping the constructor in braces:
<modest:Map provider="{new FancyCustomMapProvider()}" .../>
